title: UrbanSAM: Learning Invariance-Inspired Adapters for Segment Anything Models in Urban Construction
author: Chenyu Li (Southeast University), Danfeng Hong (Chinese Academy of Sciences), Bing Zhang (Chinese Academy of Sciences), Yuxuan Li (Chinese Academy of Sciences), Gustau Camps-Valls (Universitat de Valencia), Xiao Xiang Zhu (Technical University of Munich), Jocelyn Chanussot (Univ. Grenoble Alpes), ...
relevance_why: The paper addresses segmentation tasks in urban environments, which could provide insights for audio-visual integration where similar spatial analysis is needed.
background: Segmenting diverse urban objects in high-resolution remote sensing images to support urban planning and management.
contribution: UrbanSAM introduces a customized version of the Segment Anything Model (SAM) incorporating learnable prompters for improved urban segmentation, achieving significant performance gains across scale-varying urban objects.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggled with scale variations and relied heavily on manual prompts, compromising segmentation accuracy.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs a U-scaling adapter to automatically learn scale-invariant features, significantly reducing reliance on manual intervention.

key_innovation: Utilizes a multiresolution analysis approach within a novel adapter design to achieve invariant feature learning across different scales, enhancing adaptability for urban segmentation tasks.
real_world_impact: The proposed method has the potential to transform urban planning and monitoring by facilitating more accurate and efficient segmentation from remote sensing data, leading to better resource management.
limitations: No specific limitations mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.U-scaling adapters: **U-scaling adapters** are learnable modules designed to capture scale-invariant features, improving the model's capability to segment objects at different resolutions.

open_sourcing: The datasets and codes will be openly available at https://github.com/danfenghong
